title: Want to make Yasuo not permabanned? Make him actually land his abilities properly.
body:
Tons of people have all kinds of reasons why they can't stand Yasuo, but I for one only have a problem with him for one simply reason that I don't see being discussed a whole lot:

His abilities are absurdly forgiving in allowing him to the land them. If this nonsense were fixed, it would go a long way. He's so infuriating because it feels extremely unfair he didn't use his abilities properly\at the right time and it lets him use them anyway. I don't know another champion that is more egregious in this. Here's some examples:

* ** His ULT**: It's almost unbelievable the window he has on his ult. I can't count the number of times me or other teammates have landed on the ground from a knock up and it allows his ult to go off anyway. It looks hilariously stupid to watch this happen and yet it can happen every game a Yasuo is in.

* **His Windwall**: Again, same thing. His wall should not be blocking abilities before it is actually out on the playing field. Currently, a Yasuo can have my skillshot literally be .1 inches from his face, and he hits W and the animation barely starts and it blocks it with only his sword having moved in the animation. It's silly and feels ridiculous.

* **His Dash with Windwall**: This is piggybacking off the point above but still valid. I can't count the number of times a Yasuo has put his wall up, he is on the same side of it as I am, and when I cast an ability and he tries to dash through a minion it lets him just block my ability even though his character has not crossed to other side of the wall.  It's like as long as he starts his E animation near the wall it doesn't matter it just grants him the wall blocking it.

* **HIs Tornados**: Now this could be lag or hitcoding or whatever I'm not sure, but I have been hit plenty of times and knocked up outside of the nado animation. 

All of this combines to frustrating play and leaves nearly no room for counterplay since any attempt to outwit a Yasuo just results in Yasuo either landing abilities he shouldn't, or unintentionally blocking my abilities I casted not because I am an idiot and casted spells into a windwall, but because I thought it would land on him and the game just said yeah right not happening.

replies.body: This doesn't even mention how he can forego having to land the tornado, by just E + Q, and it's impossible to dodge.

>
> This doesn't even mention how he can forego having to land the tornado, by just E + Q, and it's impossible to dodge.


Forget that. Lets talk about how he can forgo having to even hold his Mouse so long as a team member has anythign even remotely resembling a displacement so he doesn't even have to land his 3rd Q, completely usurping the counter play of the ability.

Just stop putting him outside of turret range when he ults.  Every other champion with a channeled ability has to stand in turret range to use it to kill someone at the turret.  That's a conscious decision that has to be made: "Can I kill them before the turret kills me?".  Yasuo doesn't need to be Riot's special little guy.

Hell, that goes for any ability that would put a champ in turret range.  Should Malphite teleport out of turret range after his ult lands, so he doesn't take "unavoidable" 2-3 turret shots after he stops?  Does that even sound like it would make any sense?
Wait. Is it actually a channeled ability? I thought it was just an ability with a long animation, like Ezreal's or Lux's ultimates, not a channeled ability like Katarina's ultimate.

Malph wouldn't take 2-3 unavoidable tower shots though, he'd take... one.

No other champion has a mechanic that forces them to stay in tower range, besides Warwick and Malz. Malz is ranged, so shouldn't be in tower range normally, and Warwick already has godly diving capabilities.

"window on his ult too long"
You do realize that's simply the duration of CC on you right?
Once the CC ends, he can no longer ult

When a knockup is ending, you're about to land on the ground, and it visually looks like you're almost on the ground BUT, you're still CC'd. 
There is nothing wrong with his window to ult, it only lasts as long as the knockup affecting you

I have watched players on countless occasions hit the ground, Yasuo ults, and it rises them back up in the air. Not visually look like. They hit the ground and then get ulted.

The CC duration is irrelevant. His Ult specifically says airborne targets. They aren't airborne and the ult works.

"Airborne" is referring to the CC
Don't tell me "oh i don't care"

Are they airborne? 
-> Yes -> Ult is castable 
-> No -> Ult is not castable

Any and all knockups/displacements ARE airborne CC
Don't tell me you don't care about CC duration, because the airborne effect COMES from the CC 

I don't care if the enemy is 1 pixel off the ground and you THINK they're on the ground 
If there is 0.000001s left until the Knockup ends, Yasuo can still ult off it, which is how it should and does work

https://media.giphy.com/media/13b2rOl9IoHKog/giphy.gif

Just did this first try. I watch it land(It STOPS MOVING). I hit R. Ult goes off.

They aren't airborne and it allows the ult. End of story. If you still can't grasp this, I don't know what else to tell you. Take the horse blinders off? Either way, no sense in responding anymore.

EDIT: Just noticed this too. You can even see the "in the air indicator" disappear, and then it allows me to ult after it.

> [{quoted}](name=FeelsCampedMan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Yl5xzVuI,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2017-06-03T21:32:09.123+0000)
>if the enemy is 1 pixel off the ground

Look heres the thing, if Yasuo was able to ult people after the CC ends, you'd see them get spell, auto off, or move even an inch.

But that doesn't happen, because once they're free from the knockup, they can't be ulted, and they can't issue any commands until the CC on them ends

> It's like as long as he starts his E animation near the wall it doesn't matter it just grants him the wall blocking it.

Actually, yes, that is how it works. No dash required. Yasuo can throw Wind Wall 180 degrees away from where the Projectile is coming from and it will block the projectile, so long as he's casting it at the last moment.

That's not what the OP was talking about in the part you quoted. It sounds like he's saying that when he targets Yasuo with a projectile while Yasuo's wind wall is already on the battlefield and Yasuo attempts to dash through his wind wall, the projectile is popped before Yasuo even crosses the wind wall because Yasuo is dashing through the wind wall.

Yasuo's E, which the OP is talking about in the part that you quoted, is his dash - not his wind wall. He's not talking about the way that Yasuo's wind wall forms right behind him.
Yep, this is exactly what I am talking about.
